definitions.definition: To madden, to anger, to frustrate.

definitions.example: He's got this mad idea that he's irresistible to women.

definitions.definition: (chiefly US; informal in UK) Angry, annoyed.

definitions.example: It's mad that I got that job back a day after being fired.
to be mad with terror, lust, or hatred

definitions.definition: Extremely foolish or unwise; irrational; imprudent.
(usually with for or about) Extremely enthusiastic about; crazy about; infatuated with; overcome with desire for.
definitions.example: Aren't you just mad for that red dress?

definitions.definition: (of animals) Abnormally ferocious or furious; or, rabid, affected with rabies.
(chiefly Northeastern US) Intensifier, signifies an abundance or high quality of a thing; very, much or many.
definitions.example: I gotta give you mad props for scoring us those tickets.   Their lead guitarist has mad skills.   There are always mad girls at those parties.

definitions.definition: (of a compass needle) Having impaired polarity.
Intensifier; to a large degree; extremely; exceedingly; very; unbelievably.
definitions.example: He seems mad keen on her.
